title: What would you SERIOUSLY want at a small town gaming event?
body: Title:Maybe a list with dot points

replies.body:
4 plasma tv's,

Plasma 1) 24/7 AFL channel

Plasma 2) Twitch.tv LCS streamers or imaqtpie

Plasma 3) Vods of LCK

Plasma 4) Vods of LCS

Super good internet (NBN)

Food and drinks with multiple fridges around for people to store their drinks/food

Neon lights instead of your generic school lights

Prizes and shit to be won with tournaments also.

> [{quoted}](name=Nestay,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KLjE6ifE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-05-22T08:21:20.457+0000)
>
> 4 plasma tv's,
> 
> Plasma 1) 24/7 AFL channel
> 
> Plasma 2) Twitch.tv LCS streamers or imaqtpie
> 
> Plasma 3) Vods of LCK
>

> Super good internet (NBN)
> 
> Food and drinks with multiple fridges around for people to store their drinks/food
> 
> Neon lights instead of your generic school lights
> 
> Prizes and shit to be won with tournaments also.

This is for me ( a solo man) to do? lel
Why not, I might make my room like this lol.

you make your room with 4 plasmas and nbn gg
NBN in a few months and getn them new LG 1mm thick tvs that can be hung on walls with magnets.

> [{quoted}](name=ShuffledPancake,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KLjE6ifE,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-22T09:37:10.836+0000)
>
> Plz link me to an example by one person (a gaming event) you preferably

This could all be done out of a private house, as long as the net is very good. And you pay a cable bill. I could do it out of my house in NZ quite easily, but I dont imagine anyone round my neck of the woods it interested in AFL, let alone league.

> [{quoted}](name=ThatsBS,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KLjE6ifE,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-22T09:43:12.268+0000)

So you couldnt do it? fair ty tho lel

i like what other people have said, but to add to it:
energy drinks, sushi, pizza, vanilla coke, sprite, chips, sausage rolls, pies, pasties, alcohol

I could get bigger ones and soak the in alcohol and some not  XD

hmm... I still have the documentation for the scavenger hunts and other activities we did at Lucca Comics 2013 and 2014, major comic/gaming event in Tuscany (Italy). More than a hundred people participated every day, it was a nice way to involve people even with the limited availability of computers and tournament spots.

What sort of gaming event are we talking about?

> [{quoted}](name=Ediwir,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KLjE6ifE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-22T08:12:17.530+0000)

More than a hundred people participated every day, it was a nice way to involve people even with the limited availability of computers and tournament spots.
> 
> What sort of gaming event are we talking about?

Not anything big, just for people in my hometown... Bunch of tvs,pcs,ps4s,xbones etc
